frameDefinitions: This frame concerns an Evaluee being judged for its quality, i.e. how much it would probably be liked.
A Cognizer calls up an episodic memory of past Experience or an Impression of a Salient_entity formed  on the basis of past experience.
A Speaker addresses an Addressee with a Message, which may be indirectly referred to as a Topic.
A Cognizer retains facts in memory and is able to retrieve them.
One Part of a larger Whole has been mentioned, is inferrable, or is available in the discourse setting and the previously unmentioned part, the Rest, is now mentioned.
These words relate to the relative ordering of two events or times.
frameExamples: Kozmo could <t>remember</t> when his modem was the fastest he could buy.
I was impressed that she 'd actually <t>remembered</t> Radish 's name (= what Radish's name is)
The lenses , like the <t><fex name='Rest'>rest</fex></t> of the exoskeleton, are made of calcite.
<t>After</t> she arrived , she laid out her papers on the desk.
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Evaluee</fen> is being judged for its quality.
This role marks expressions that denote a scalar property of the <fen>Evaluee</fen> with respect to which the <fen>Evaluee</fen> is judged.
A person who recalls memories of past experience or impressions.
A person or thing that the <fen>Cognizer</fen> remembers as being involved in some state or event or as having some property.
A past event or state that the <fen>Cognizer</fen> witnessed and is now recalling. The <fen>Experience</fen> may be a specific event or state or a vaguer period that is treated as a unit.

A property that the <fen>Cognizer</fen> attributes to the <fen>Salient_entity</fen> based on their past experience of the <fen>Salient_entity</fen> or a category to which the <fen>Salient_entity</fen> is assigned.
A property or role that a <fen>Salient_entity</fen> actually held and which frames the memories that the <fen>Cognizer</fen> has of the <fen>Salient_entity</fen>.
The time when the <fen>Cognizer</fen> remembers the experience.
The <fen>Speaker</fen> is the sentient entity that produces the <fen>Message</fen>.
The <fen>Addressee</fen> receives the <fen>Message</fen> from the <fen>Speaker</fen>.
The <fen>Message</fen> is the communication produced by the <fen>Speaker</fen>.
The <fen>Topic</fen> is a general description of the content of the <fen>Message</fen>.
This role is the <fen>Medium</fen> in which the <fen>Message</fen> is expressed.
The <fen>Time</fen> during which the <fen>Speaker</fen> informs the <fen>Addressee</fen> of the <fen>Message</fen>.
<fen>Place</fen> is the location in which the <fen>Speaker</fen> informs  the <fen>Addressee</fen> of the <fen>Message</fen>.
The person who retains and retrieves information.
<fen>Mental_content</fen> stored by and accessible to the <fen>Cognizer</fen>. It may derive from experience or activity or simply from being informed of it.
The time when the <fen>Cognizer</fen> retrieves <fen>Mental_content</fen> or forgets it.
A <fen>Part</fen> of a larger <fen>Whole</fen> that has been mentioned in prior discourse or is available in the discourse setting.
The previously unmentioned part of the <fen>Whole</fen>.
The larger entitiy or group that is fully made up of the <fen>Part</fen> and the <fen>Rest</fen>.

The <fen>Focal_occasion</fen> is the event which is  being located in time with respect to some other event: The <fen>Focal_occasion</fen> is profiled, in contrast to the <fen>Landmark_occasion</fen>, which is backgrounded.
The <fen>Landmark_occasion</fen> is the event  with respect to which the <fen>Focal_occasion</fen> is located.
The <fen>Focal_participant</fen> is the participant in the <fen>Focal_occasion</fen> which is profiled as being in a relation of relative time to the <fen>Landmark_occasion</fen>.
listRoleExamples: He gave me another lame <fex>excuse</fex>.
The Beaujolais Nouveau is dazzling <fex>in freshness</fex>.
I will truly miss Delmar and <fex>I</fex> will always remember when his eyes lit up everytime he got ice-cream.
today I saw a sister's exclassmate, and didn't recognise him, I remember <fex>him</fex> taller.
I can still remember <fex>saying the pledge every morning before class in elementary school</fex>, a rare occurrence among elementary school kids nowadays.
I remember Peter <fex>as immensely kind in those first three weeks before I was packed off to boarding school</fex>.
Atulprasad is principally remembered <fex>as a musician and composer</fex>.
I 'll <fex>never</fex> forget being in hospital
<fex>Bill</fex> told me that he would come to the party.
The authorities informed me <fex>that my brother had been arrested</fex>.
Leroy told his mother <fex>about his arrest</fex>.

Even when we had a size problem they informed me <fex>right away</fex> and everything worked
out great.
She looked at it for a few moments, thinking of Mark Smeaton and what he had told her <fex>on the steps of City Hall</fex>.
I bet <fex>Johno</fex> can remember the name of the Ramones' drummer.
Do you remember <fex>how to spell cupboard ?</fex>
<fex>Afterwards</fex>, I forgot what I was pissed off about, but I was.
the GP had stipulated counselling as a complement <fex>to medication</fex>
You should try to persuade the <fex>rest</fex> of the family to do so whatever their personal opinions
<fex>Hours of eating and drinking</fex> followed the wedding ceremony.
Hours of eating and drinking followed <fex>the wedding ceremony</fex>.
<fex>We</fex> were late for dinner.
